reason: Significant institutional capital inflows via Bitcoin ETFs ($1.2B) and strong Wall Street integration narrative suggest a robust markup phase with bullish price predictions. However, regulatory uncertainties, highlighted by Coinbase's stance on a major crypto bill and rumors of White House threats (albeit refuted), introduce considerable volatility and risk. Immediate resistance is projected at $75,000, with strong support forming around $68,000 as dips are likely to be bought amidst this bullish sentiment.
headlines: Here is why $1.2 billion Bitcoin ETF inflow is a new bullish signal
Wall Street integration will power crypto’s next phase, says Fidelity Digital Assets
Here's why Coinbase and other companies soured on major crypto bill
Bitcoin to $180,000, stablecoins to soar in 2026, investor Dan Tapiero predicts
Coinbase refutes rumors of White House's threat to pull support for crypto bill
